text: Refrigerated 75 cl bottle corked and capped. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is nice Apple, medium body, lower carbonation, and a little white head. Taste is somewhat rich apple, some honey, with a little slightly herbal. Very nice and very easy to drink.
Golden straw color, white head. Over-ripe apple nose, cellar, cheese, earthy notes. Sweet taste, apple, hints of spice and cellar, light acidity. Light body, average carbonation.
Sample at SBWF 2016. Fresh and fruity smell with apples. Similar taste, sweet with ripe apples. Refreshing.

Bottle @ Home. Bright golden colored cider with a short lived, fizzy white head and fairly lively bubbles. Huge apple character here. Really fresh, juicy, semi-sweet apple. Good balance of acid here, too. Notes of baked apple, lemon juice, and white grape. Really surprisingly good body and mouthfeel, too. Slight funky of earth and a touch of spice. Really solid, as have been all the ciders from this producer.

Intense fresh-milled apple pulp aroma with light touches of hay, minerals, fall leaves. Medium-light bodied, sweet and juicy with vibrant effervescence and luscious soft carbonation, the finish is beautifully sweet-acidic and salivating, and another gulp is required. Beauty in simplicity.

Un superbe cidre au nez typé sur des notes de pommes surettes, sur un fond lévuré et minéral. La bouche est droite, nette, délicieusement fruitée et la finale finement acidulée. un grand exercice de style. Un régal

Bottle from I-dont-remember-where. Listed as 4% on the label.

Vivid gold pour, sparkling. Warm apple aromas, just a bit of vinegar intensity. The flavors are sweeter and less complex than the other Eric Bordelet cider and less intense than the perry, but its a lovely mouthful of the best sparkling cider one has ever tasted, mostly sweet apple up front with just a bit of tannic intensity very late. Very delicious but certainly on the sweet side for what I usually like to drink; think Alpenfire.

Sidra suau, té una entrada dolça amb un final que es va fent cada cop més àcida.
Sidra suave, tiene una entrada dulce con un final que se va haciendo cada vez mas ácida.
Bottle @ home. Clear golden color with a fizzy small white head. Distinct clear  notes of  apple, Apple skin,  slightly funky. Crisp with a dry and tart apple finish. Refreshing.
Pale yellow color, big fizzy head at first. Clean and sweet apple aroma. Sweet taste with a dry finish. Like taking a bite of a ripe Granny Smith. Fizzy and fresh mouthfeel. Excellent!
Bottle sample at SBWF15. Clear golden with white head. Aroma is sweet and juicy, raw apple juice, earth and slight funk. Taste is sweet, apple, light tart, light funk, some apple skins. Tasty!

75 cl bottle at SMÖF 2015, October 24.Also mentioned "Eric Bordelet" on the label.Light hazy golden color, white head. Apple, light tart, also sweet scent. Fizzy, very fizzy actually, mouthfeel. Apple, tart taste. Apple aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity sweetish spicy apple aroma. Sweetish spicy apple flavor. Has a sweetish spicy apple finish.

September 11, 2015. Bottle at home, 3.5% ABV 
Clear golden with a large frothy, quickly dissipating, white head. Aroma is sweet juicy baked apples, hints of apple skins and a very light earthy, funky notes. Taste is sweet baked apples, very light tartness. Finish is juicy apples, light funky and very light tart apple skins. Light bodied, light dry, small bubble carbonation. Very easy drinkable cider with lots of apple flavor.

Bottle big from SB web cons 2015-07-26 Göteborg
AR: sweet green/yellow apples
AP: golden clear no head
F: sweet green/apples, cocked apples, wee

Bottle bought @ Sustembolaget. Pours clear sparkling golden with a small white head that doesnt leave any trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity, slightly funky and rustic with smashed ripe mealy apples, star fruit, hay, minerals and lemon peal. Taste is slightly sweet, tiny sour, tiny funky and rustic. Mouthfeel is tiny dry, slightly tart, tiny apple skin astringent, tiny sparkling and light to medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and tiny sour with yellow apples, star fruit, pineapple, hay, minerals, barnyard, lemon peal and hints of paper. Solid low abv farmhouse cider. Refreshing, balanced and tasty!

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 Get a lot of baked apple on the nose! Fresh at the same time. Mouthfeel is very smooth. Taste is great! Sweet, hint of bitter and just a very little tartness. Loads of apples! Very nice!
Bomber. Rich golden clear pour. Baked apple all over this. Rich and lightly sweet. Touch tart. Excellent.
Bottle oro limpido succo di mela ben profumato elegante piuttosto dolce ma buona beva

750 mL bottle at Queen and Beaver in Toronto, served in a wine glass. Pours clear golden with a small white head that fades to a thin remnant as leaves a trace of lace. The nose has notes of baked apple, apple skin, honey and apple blossoms. The flavor is moderately sweet with baked apple notes from the nose, honey and skins. The finish is heavier in apple skin. On the palate it is light-medium in body with a smooth, watery texture and soft carbonation. Overall, a truly excellent cider. Subtle, smooth and sophisticated, a masterpiece. 2014-06-30
